pullRequest.body:
This is stupid, but it's the only case I care about in APAP. Can be made less stupid later.

From LeanAPAP

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
### PR summary [74703d5e8d](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17275/commits/74703d5e8d2ac4f8b5e24694c71713739a73e717)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Constructions.AddChar`|702|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instDiscreteMeasurableSpace`
`+ instMeasurableSpace`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

I'm not entirely convinced this is the right measurable space in general for mathlib. What do you think of having this under the assumption that A is a discrete measurable space? This seems to be strong enough for our application but weak enough to not break more general settings.
You mean adding `[DiscreteMeasurableSpace A]` to the instance? That would be an unused variable.

I support Bhavik's point here: this is way too broad ‚Äì¬†there are certainly people (e.g. me) who care about spaces of AddChars that have natural topologies, measures, etc which are not discrete. I think you should add `[DiscreteMeasurableSpace A]` to the hypotheses, and maybe `[DiscreteMeasurableSpace M]` as well (we do not want the discrete measure-space structure on AddChar ‚Ñ§ ‚Ñù). 

The linter does not complain, which is the Right Thing: it makes no sense to complain about unused hypotheses when the output contains data, it isn't just a Prop, as here.
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by loefflerd.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11315977938/job/31467791689)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11315977938/job/31467791783)
I'm happy to go along with this now, modulo one small fix to the module docstring.
I'm happy to go along with this now, modulo one small fix to the module docstring.

```suggestion
This file endows `AddChar A M` with the discrete measurable space structure whenever `A` and `M` 
are themselves discrete measurable spaces.
```
(I think "trivial" is unclear here ‚Äì it could refer either to the top or the bottom element of the lattice of sigma-algebras ‚Äì¬†so I suggest "discrete".)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `MeasurableSpace` instance for `AddChar`

You mean adding `[DiscreteMeasurableSpace A]` to the instance? That would be an unused variable.

I support Bhavik's point here: this is way too broad ‚Äì¬†there are certainly people (e.g. me) who care about spaces of AddChars that have natural topologies, measures, etc which are not discrete.
